p: Nikolin et al. (51) reported that a single nucleotide substitution at site 134 in both the P and V proteins, which resulted in a nonsynonomous amino acid substitution, encoded glycine (G) in all canine Serengeti isolates and encoded serine (S) in all non-canine Serengeti isolates. This substitution results in a glutamine at site 126 [ 52] in the C protein.
